Executive Director of WFP and His Party Leave Here
articles.content:
Executive Director of WFP and His Party Leave Here 
    Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- James T. Morris, executive director of the World Food Programme (WFP), and his party left here today.
 They were seen off at the airport by Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.

Greetings to King of Bahrain
articles.content:
Greetings to King of Bahrain
    Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Dec. 15 sent a message of greetings to Sheikh Hamad Bin Isa al-Khalifa, king of Bahrain, on the occasion of the 44th anniversary of its national day.
 The message expressed the conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and sincerely wished the friendly people of Bahrain steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Wreath Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Wreath Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
    Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Women of foreign embassies and missions of international organizations here laid a wreath before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero  Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs' Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Dec. 15 on the occasion of her 88th birth anniversary.
 They laid the wreath and observed a moment's silence with unbound reverence for Kim Jong Suk, woman general of Mt. Paektu, who set a noble example in devotedly safeguarding the leader and devoted her all to the liberation of the country and the happiness of the people true to the leadership of President Kim Il Sung.    
 Letters reading "The revolutionary exploits of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk will be immortal!" were seen on the ribbon of the wreath.
